Key Arguments: The legislation would give ACMA the power to control free speech, undermining Australia's commitment to freedom of speech.
Australia has obligations under international human rights treaties to uphold freedom of speech and expression.
The proposed legislation is incompatible with the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR) and the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights (ISESCR).
All new Bills must be assessed for compatibility with human rights under the Human Rights (Parliamentary Scrutiny) Act 2011.
The Australian Human Rights Commission Act 1986 ensures human rights are upheld, and this Bill would bypass these protections.
Notable Quotes: If this Bill is passed it would give the Australian Communications and Media Authority (ACMA) the power to control free speech in Australia, making Australiaâ€™s commitment to freedom of speech meaningless.
This Bill would allow ACMA to bypass all these Acts, laws and ratified treaties and strip people of their rights.
